body:
With the latest version in master, we have `.reshape` which is roughly equivalent to `.contiguous().view()`. This removes the main use-case that we have (for end users) to call `.contiguous()`.

I think over time we will gradually reduce the need of `.contiguous()` to be applied by the end-user, even though it will still exist in the backend implementation, as it simplifies implementation.
